alert.note: Alert for Lorain; Medina (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 8:28PM EDT until August 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Huron and Lorain. In northeast Ohio, Medina. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Medina, Brunswick, North Royalton, Grafton, Wellington, New London, Broadview Heights, Hinckley, Lagrange, Penfield, Pittsfield, Spencer, North Fairfield, Rochester, Valley City and Montrose-Ghent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
